original: Aggaññasutta

original: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
analyzed: evam me suta
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati pubbārāme migāramātupāsāde.🔽Tena kho pana samayena vāseṭṭhabhāradvājā bhikkhūsu parivasanti bhikkhubhāvaṁ ākaṅkhamānā.🔽Atha kho bhagavā sāyanhasamayaṁ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito pāsādā orohitvā pāsādapacchāyāyaṁ abbhokāse caṅkamati.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati pubbārāme migāra mātu pāsāde  tena kho pana samayena vāseṭṭha bhāradvājāḥ bhikkhūsu parivasanti bhikkhu bhāvam ākaṅkhamānāḥ  atha kho bhagavā sāyanha samayam paṭisallānā vuṭṭhitaḥ pāsādāḥ orohitvā pāsāda pacchāya ayam abbhokāse caṅkamati
translated: On one occasion the Blessed One was dwelling at Sāvatthī in the Eastern Park in the Mansion of Migāra’s Mother. 🔽Now on that occasion Vāseṭṭha and Bhāradvāja were living at Sāvatthī, seeking sole access to the Buddha, desiring to attend to the Buddha.🔽Then, when it was evening, the Blessed One rose from meditation and came down from the walk.

original: Addasā kho vāseṭṭho bhagavantaṁ sāyanhasamayaṁ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhitaṁ pāsādā orohitvā pāsādapacchāyāyaṁ abbhokāse caṅkamantaṁ.
analyzed: addasā kho vāseṭṭhaḥ bhagavantam sāyanha samayam paṭisallānā vuṭṭhitam pāsādāḥ orohitvā pāsāda pacchāyāyam abbhokāse caṅkamanta
translated: Vāseṭṭha saw the Blessed One coming in the distance

original: Disvāna bhāradvājaṁ āmantesi:🔽“ayaṁ, āvuso bhāradvāja, bhagavā sāyanhasamayaṁ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito pāsādā orohitvā pāsādapacchāyāyaṁ abbhokāse caṅkamati.
analyzed: disvāna bhāradvājam āmantesi  āvuso bhāradvāja bhagavā sāyanha samayam paṭisallānā vuṭṭhitaḥ pāsādā orohitvā pāsāda pacchāya ayam abbhokāse caṅkamati
translated: and told Bhāradvāja:🔽“Friend Bhāradvāja, the Blessed One is coming.

original: Āyāmāvuso bhāradvāja, yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamissāma;
analyzed: āyāma āvusaḥ bhāradvāja yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkamissāma
translated: Let’s go to meet him and inform him that we are living at Sāvatthī, seeking sole access to the Buddha, desiring to attend to the Buddha.”

original: appeva nāma labheyyāma bhagavato santikā dhammiṁ kathaṁ savanāyā”ti.
analyzed: appā iva nāma labheyyāma bhagavato santikā dhammim katham savanāya ati
translated: Perhaps we could get the opportunity to hear a teaching from the Buddha.”

original: “Evamāvuso”ti kho bhāradvājo vāseṭṭhassa paccassosi.
analyzed: evam āvuso ti kho bhāradvājaḥ vāseṭṭhassa paccassosi
translated: “Yes, friend,” replied Bhāradvāja.

original: Atha kho vāseṭṭhabhāradvājā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā bhagavantaṁ caṅkamantaṁ anucaṅkamiṁsu.
analyzed: atha khalu vāseṭṭha bhāradvājāḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkamisu upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā bhagavantam caṅkamantam anucaṅkamisu
translated: They then went to the Buddha, bowed, and followed him as he walked.

original: Atha kho bhagavā vāseṭṭhaṁ āmantesi:🔽“tumhe khvattha, vāseṭṭha, brāhmaṇajaccā brāhmaṇakulīnā brāhmaṇakulā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajitā, kacci vo, vāseṭṭha, brāhmaṇā na akkosanti na paribhāsantī”ti?🔽“Taggha no, bhante, brāhmaṇā akkosanti paribhāsanti attarūpāya paribhāsāya paripuṇṇāya, no aparipuṇṇāyā”ti.
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavā vāseṭṭham āmantesi  tumhe khvattha vāseṭṭha brāhmaṇa jaccāḥ brāhmaṇa kulīnāḥ brāhmaṇa kulāḥ agārasmai anagāriyam pabbajitā kacci vaḥ vāseṭṭha brāhmaṇāḥ na akkosanti na paribhāsanti iti  tat ha naḥ bhante brāhmaṇāḥ akkosanti paribhāsanti atta rūpāya paribhāsāya paripuṇṇāya no a paripuṇṇāya ati
translated: The Buddha then said to Vāseṭṭha,🔽“Vāseṭṭha, you were born into a brahmin family and you’ve gone forth from the home life into homelessness. Do the brahmins abuse and insult you?”🔽“Yes, Sir, they do.”

original: “Yathā kathaṁ pana vo, vāseṭṭha, brāhmaṇā akkosanti paribhāsanti attarūpāya paribhāsāya paripuṇṇāya, no aparipuṇṇāyā”ti?
analyzed: yathā katham pana vaḥ vāseṭṭha brāhmaṇāḥ akkosanti paribhāsanti atta rūpāya paribhāsāya paripuṇṇāya no a paripuṇṇāya ati
translated: “But how do they abuse and insult you?”

original: “Brāhmaṇā, bhante, evamāhaṁsu:🔽‘brāhmaṇova seṭṭho vaṇṇo, hīnā aññe vaṇṇā.
analyzed: brāhmaṇāḥ bhante  brāhmaṇaḥ uva seṭṭhaḥ vaṇṇaḥ hīnāḥ aññe vaṇṇā
translated: “Sir, the brahmins say this:🔽‘Brahmins are the highest caste, those of other castes are inferior.

original: Brāhmaṇova sukko vaṇṇo, kaṇhā aññe vaṇṇā.
analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ uva sukkaḥ vaṇṇaḥ kaṇhāḥ aññe vaṇṇā
translated: Brahmins are the fairest caste, those of other castes are dark.

original: Brāhmaṇāva sujjhanti, no abrāhmaṇā.
analyzed: brāhmaṇā ava sujjhanti naḥ abrāhmaṇā
translated: Only brahmins are purified, not non-brahmins.

original: Brāhmaṇāva brahmuno puttā orasā mukhato jātā brahmajā brahmanimmitā brahmadāyādā.
analyzed: brāhmaṇā ava brahmuno puttāḥ orasā mukhataḥ jātāḥ brahma jāḥ brahma nimmitāḥ brahma dāyādā
translated: Only brahmins are the sons of Brahmā, born of his mouth, born of Brahmā, created by Brahmā, heirs of Brahmā.’

original: Te tumhe seṭṭhaṁ vaṇṇaṁ hitvā hīnamattha vaṇṇaṁ ajjhupagatā, yadidaṁ muṇḍake samaṇake ibbhe kaṇhe bandhupādāpacce.
analyzed: te tumhe seṭṭham vaṇṇam hitvā hīnam attha vaṇṇam ajjhupagatāḥ yat idam muṇḍake samaṇake ibbhe kaṇhe bandhu pādāpacce
translated: So you have abandoned the highest caste and gone over to the inferior one, namely, to these shaven little ascetics, these dark dregs of the people, these low-caste men.

original: Tayidaṁ na sādhu, tayidaṁ nappatirūpaṁ, yaṁ tumhe seṭṭhaṁ vaṇṇaṁ hitvā hīnamattha vaṇṇaṁ ajjhupagatā yadidaṁ muṇḍake samaṇake ibbhe kaṇhe bandhupādāpacce’ti.
analyzed: tayidam na sādhu tayidam nappatirūpa yam tumhe seṭṭham vaṇṇam hitvā hīnam attha vaṇṇam ajjhupagatāḥ yat idam muṇḍake samaṇake ibbhe kaṇhe
translated: It’s not suitable, it’s not proper, that you have abandoned the highest caste and gone over to the inferior one, namely, to these shaven little ascetics, these dark dregs of the people, these low-caste men.’

original: Evaṁ kho no, bhante, brāhmaṇā akkosanti paribhāsanti attarūpāya paribhāsāya paripuṇṇāya, no aparipuṇṇāyā”ti.
analyzed: evam kho naḥ bhante brāhmaṇāḥ akkosanti paribhāsanti atta rūpāya paribhāsāya paripuṇṇāya no a paripuṇṇāya ati
translated: That’s how the brahmins insult and revile us, with these rude, harsh, and discourteous words, to our face, and not to our face.”

original: “Taggha vo, vāseṭṭha, brāhmaṇā porāṇaṁ assarantā evamāhaṁsu:
analyzed: tat ha vaḥ vāseṭṭha brāhmaṇā porāṇam evam āhasu
translated: “Well, Vasettha, the brahmins are just repeating what they have heard.

original: ‘brāhmaṇova seṭṭho vaṇṇo, hīnā aññe vaṇṇā;
analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ uva seṭṭhaḥ vaṇṇaḥ hīnāḥ aññe vaṇṇā
translated: ‘Brahmins are the highest caste; other castes are inferior.

original: brāhmaṇova sukko vaṇṇo, kaṇhā aññe vaṇṇā;
analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ uva sukkaḥ vaṇṇaḥ kaṇhāḥ aññe vaṇṇā
translated: Brahmins are the fairest caste; other castes are dark.

original: brāhmaṇāva sujjhanti, no abrāhmaṇā;
analyzed: brāhmaṇā ava sujjhanti naḥ abrāhmaṇā
translated: Only brahmins are purified, not non-brahmins.

original: brāhmaṇāva brahmuno puttā orasā mukhato jātā brahmajā brahmanimmitā brahmadāyādā’ti.
analyzed: brāhmaṇāḥ ava brahmuno puttāḥ orasāḥ mukhataḥ jātāḥ brahma jāḥ brahma nimmitā brahma dāyā adāti
translated: Only brahmins are the sons of Brahmā, born from his mouth, born of Brahmā, created by Brahmā, heirs of Brahmā.’

original: Dissanti kho pana, vāseṭṭha, brāhmaṇānaṁ brāhmaṇiyo utuniyopi gabbhiniyopi vijāyamānāpi pāyamānāpi.
analyzed: dissanti kho pana vāseṭṭha brāhmaṇānam brāhmaṇiyaḥ utuniyaḥ api gabbhiniyaḥ api vijāyamānā api pāyamānā api
translated: But, Vasettha, we see brahmin women menstruating, becoming pregnant, giving birth, and breastfeeding.

original: Te ca brāhmaṇā yonijāva samānā evamāhaṁsu:🔽‘brāhmaṇova seṭṭho vaṇṇo, hīnā aññe vaṇṇā;
analyzed: te ca brāhmaṇāḥ samānāḥ  brāhmaṇaḥ uva seṭṭhaḥ vaṇṇaḥ hīnāḥ aññe vaṇṇā
translated: And yet these brahmins, though born from a womb, say:🔽‘Brahmins are the highest caste; other castes are inferior.

original: brāhmaṇova sukko vaṇṇo, kaṇhā aññe vaṇṇā;
analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ uva sukkaḥ vaṇṇaḥ kaṇhāḥ aññe vaṇṇā
translated: Brahmins are the fairest caste; other castes are dark.

translated: Only brahmins are the sons of Brahmā, born from his mouth, born of Brahmā, created by Brahmā, heirs of Brahmā.’

analyzed: te brahmānam ca iva abbhācikkhanti musā ca bhāsanti bahuñca apuññam pasavanti
translated: They misrepresent Brahmā, and they speak falsely, and they will make much demerit.

original: 1. Catuvaṇṇasuddhi
analyzed: catu vaṇṇa suddhi
translated: . The Purity of the Four Castes

original: Cattārome, vāseṭṭha, vaṇṇā—
analyzed: cattāro me vāseṭṭha vaṇṇā
translated: There are, Vasettha, these four castes:

original: khattiyā, brāhmaṇā, vessā, suddā.
analyzed: khattiyāḥ brāhmaṇāḥ vessāḥ suddāḥ
translated: aristocrats, brahmins, merchants, and workers.🔽“Among aristocrats, Vasettha, some are seen to be killers of living beings, takers of what is not given, unchaste, speakers of what is false, divisive, harsh, and frivolous, and are greedy, malicious, and of wrong views.🔽“Thus, Vasettha, these things that are unwholesome, reckoned as unwholesome, culpable, reckoned as culpable, to be shunned by the wise, who have higher aspirations, are not the province of a noble disciple. They are dark with dark results, declared by the Noble One to be dark.

original: Khattiyopi kho, vāseṭṭha, idhekacco pāṇātipātī hoti adinnādāyī kāmesumicchācārī musāvādī pisuṇavāco pharusavāco samphappalāpī abhijjhālu byāpannacitto micchādiṭṭhī.

translated: “Among aristocrats, some are seen to abstain from killing living beings, from taking what is not given, from misconduct in sensual pleasures, from false speech, from divisive speech, from harsh speech, and from frivolous chatter, and they are without greed, without hatred, and of right views.

original: Iti kho, vāseṭṭha, yeme dhammā akusalā akusalasaṅkhātā sāvajjā sāvajjasaṅkhātā asevitabbā🔽asevitabbasaṅkhātā naalamariyā naalamariyasaṅkhātā kaṇhā kaṇhavipākā viññugarahitā,🔽khattiyepi te idhekacce sandissanti.

translated: “Thus, Vasettha, these things that are wholesome, reckoned as wholesome, blameless, reckoned as blameless, to be cultivated by the wise, who have higher aspirations, are the province of a noble disciple. translated: among merchants…🔽among workers, some are seen to be killers of living beings, takers of what is not given, unchaste, speakers of what is false, divisive, harsh, and frivolous, and are greedy, malicious, and of wrong views.🔽“Thus, Vasettha, these things that are unwholesome, reckoned as unwholesome, culpable, reckoned as culpable, to be shunned by the wise, who have higher aspirations, are not the province of a noble disciple. They are dark with dark results, declared by the Noble One to be dark.

original: Iti kho, vāseṭṭha, yeme dhammā akusalā akusalasaṅkhātā …pe…
analyzed: iti kho vāseṭṭha ye me dhammā akusalāḥ akusala saṅkhātā pe
translated: “Among workers, some are seen to abstain from killing living beings, from taking what is not given, from misconduct in sensual pleasures, from false speech, from divisive speech, from harsh speech, and from frivolous chatter, and they are without greed, without hatred, and of right views.

original: kaṇhā kaṇhavipākā viññugarahitā;
analyzed: kaṇhā kaṇha vipākā viññuga rahitā
translated: are dark with dark results, and are censured by wise people.

original: suddepi te idhekacce sandissanti.
analyzed: sudde pi te idha ekacce sandissanti
translated: Some of them can be seen among the outcastes.

original: Khattiyopi kho, vāseṭṭha, idhekacco pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti, adinnādānā paṭivirato,
analyzed: khattiyaḥ api kho vāseṭṭha idha ekaccaḥ pāṇātipātā paṭivirataḥ hoti adinnādānā paṭivirataḥ
translated: “Some aristocrats here abstain from killing living beings, from taking what is not given,

analyzed: paṭivirataḥ musā vādā paṭivirataḥ pisuṇāya vācāya paṭivirataḥ pharusāya
translated: from misconduct in sensual pleasures, from false speech, from malicious speech, from harsh speech,

original: vācāya paṭivirato, samphappalāpā paṭivirato, anabhijjhālu abyāpannacitto, sammādiṭṭhī.
analyzed: vācāya paṭivirato samphappalāpā paṭivirataḥ anabhijjhālu a byāpanna citto sammādiṭṭhī
translated: and from gossip; they are not covetous, they are not ill-will, and they have right view.

original: Iti kho, vāseṭṭha, yeme dhammā kusalā kusalasaṅkhātā anavajjā anavajjasaṅkhātā sevitabbā
analyzed: iti kho vāseṭṭha ye ime dhammā kusalā kusala saṅkhātā anavajjā anavajja saṅkhātā sevitabbā
translated: Thus, Vasettha, these things that are wholesome, that are reckoned wholesome, blameless, that are reckoned blameless, to be practiced,

original: sevitabbasaṅkhātā alamariyā alamariyasaṅkhātā sukkā sukkavipākā viññuppasatthā, khattiyepi
analyzed: sevitabba saṅkhātā alamariyā alamariya saṅkhātā sukkā sukka vipākā viññuppasatthā khattiye pi
translated: that are reckoned to be practiced, noble, that are reckoned noble, bright, that have bright results, and are commended by wise people,

original: te idhekacce sandissanti.
analyzed: te idha ekacce sandissanti
translated: can be seen among some aristocrats here.

original: Brāhmaṇopi kho, vāseṭṭha …pe…🔽vessopi kho, vāseṭṭha …pe…
analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ api kho vāseṭṭha pe  vessaḥ api kho vāseṭṭha pe
translated: “Some brahmins here …🔽some merchants here …

original: suddopi kho, vāseṭṭha, idhekacco pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti …pe…
analyzed: suddaḥ api kho vāseṭṭhaḥ idha ekacco pāṇātipātā paṭivirataḥ hoti pe
translated: some outcastes here abstain from killing living beings, from taking what is not given,

original: anabhijjhālu, abyāpannacitto, sammādiṭṭhī.
analyzed: an abhijjhālu a byāpanna cittaḥ sammādiṭṭhī
translated: from covetousness, from ill will, and from wrong view.

original: Iti kho, vāseṭṭha, yeme dhammā kusalā kusalasaṅkhātā anavajjā anavajjasaṅkhātā sevitabbā sevitabbasaṅkhātā alamariyā alamariyasaṅkhātā sukkā sukkavipākā viññuppasatthā;

translated: So, Vasettha, these things are wholesome, blameless, to be cultivated, and are praised by the wise.

original: suddepi te idhekacce sandissanti.
analyzed: sudde pi te idha ekacce sandissanti
translated: And some of them are to be found among the low-born.

original: Imesu kho, vāseṭṭha, catūsu vaṇṇesu evaṁ ubhayavokiṇṇesu vattamānesu kaṇhasukkesu dhammesu viññugarahitesu ceva viññuppasatthesu ca yadettha brāhmaṇā evamāhaṁsu:

translated: Now, Vasettha, when these four castes are thus mixed together, and there is no fixed rule, and a man is of uncertain birth, being unable to show his ancestry either on his father’s or on his mother’s side for seven generations, then the Brahmins say:

analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ uva seṭṭhaḥ vaṇṇaḥ hīnāḥ aññe vaṇṇā
translated: ‘The Brahmin is the highest caste, other castes are inferior;

original: brāhmaṇova sukko vaṇṇo, kaṇhā aññe vaṇṇā;
analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ uva sukkaḥ vaṇṇaḥ kaṇhāḥ aññe vaṇṇā
translated: the Brahmin is the pure caste, other castes are impure;

original: brāhmaṇāva sujjhanti, no abrāhmaṇā;
analyzed: brāhmaṇā ava sujjhanti naḥ abrāhmaṇā
translated: only Brahmins are the purified arahats, not non-Brahmins;

original: brāhmaṇāva brahmuno puttā orasā mukhato jātā brahmajā brahmanimmitā brahmadāyādā’ti.
analyzed: brāhmaṇāḥ ava brahmuno puttāḥ orasāḥ mukhataḥ jātāḥ brahma jāḥ brahma nimmitā brahma dāyā adāti
translated: only Brahmins are the sons of Brahma, born from his mouth, born of Brahma, created by Brahma, heirs of Brahma.’

original: Taṁ tesaṁ viññū nānujānanti.
analyzed: tam tesam viññū na anujānanti
translated: But the wise do not admit this.

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: And why not?

original: Imesañhi, vāseṭṭha, catunnaṁ vaṇṇānaṁ yo hoti bhikkhu arahaṁ khīṇāsavo vusitavā katakaraṇīyo
analyzed: imesam hi vāseṭṭha catunnam vaṇṇānam yaḥ hoti bhikkhu araham khīṇa āsavaḥ vusitavā kata karaṇīyaḥ
translated: For, Vasettha, a bhikkhu who is an arahant, whose taints are destroyed, who has lived the life, done what had to be done,🔽

original: ohitabhāro anuppattasadattho parikkhīṇabhavasaṁyojano sammadaññāvimutto, so nesaṁ
analyzed: ohita bhāraḥ an uppatta sat atthaḥ parikkhīṇa bhava sayojanaḥ sammad aññā vimutto so na īsa
translated: For, Vasettha, the bhikkhu who is an arahant, whose taints are destroyed, who has lived the holy life, done what had to be done, laid down the burden, reached his own goal, utterly destroyed the fetters of existence, and is completely liberated through final knowledge,🔽is declared to be foremost among them,

original: aggamakkhāyati dhammeneva, no adhammena.🔽Dhammo hi, vāseṭṭha, seṭṭho janetasmiṁ, diṭṭhe ceva dhamme abhisamparāyañca.
analyzed: aggam akkhāyati dhammena iva no adhammena  dhammaḥ hi vāseṭṭha seṭṭhaḥ janetasmi diṭṭhe ca iva dhamme abhisamparāyan ca
translated: not by virtue of mere oral tradition, but by virtue of the truth.🔽For the Dhamma is the best thing for people in this world and the next.

original: Tadamināpetaṁ, vāseṭṭha, pariyāyena veditabbaṁ, yathā dhammova seṭṭho janetasmiṁ, diṭṭhe ceva dhamme abhisamparāyañca.
analyzed: vāseṭṭha pariyāyena veditabba yathā dhamma uva seṭṭhaḥ janetasmi diṭṭhe ca iva dhamme abhisamparāyañca
translated: And this, Vasettha, is another way in which it may be understood how the Dhamma is the best thing for people in this world and the next.

original: Jānāti kho, vāseṭṭha, rājā pasenadi kosalo:
analyzed: jānāti kho vāseṭṭha rājā pasenadi kosalaḥ
translated: King Pasenadi of Kosala knows that

original: ‘samaṇo gotamo anantarā sakyakulā pabbajito’ti.🔽Sakyā kho pana, vāseṭṭha, rañño pasenadissa kosalassa anuyuttā bhavanti.
analyzed: samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ anantarā sakya kulā pabbajito ti  sakyā kho pana vāseṭṭha raññaḥ pasenadissa kosalassa anuyuttāḥ bhavanti
translated: the ascetic Gotama has gone forth from the Sakya clan.🔽And the Sakyans are devoted to King Pasenadi of Kosala.

original: Karonti kho, vāseṭṭha, sakyā raññe pasenadimhi kosale nipaccakāraṁ abhivādanaṁ paccuṭṭhānaṁ añjalikammaṁ sāmīcikammaṁ.
analyzed: karonti kho vāseṭṭha sakyāḥ raññe pasenadimhi kosale nipaccakāram abhivādanam paccuṭṭhānam añjali kammam sāmīci kamma
translated: They do acts of homage, rising up to greet him, making verbal salutations and performing the proper duties.

original: Iti kho, vāseṭṭha, yaṁ karonti sakyā raññe pasenadimhi kosale nipaccakāraṁ abhivādanaṁ
analyzed: iti kho vāseṭṭha yam karonti sakyāḥ raññe pasenadimhi kosale nipaccakāram abhivādana
translated: So, Vasettha, the Sakyans do for the King of Kosala what they do for the Tathagata,

original: paccuṭṭhānaṁ añjalikammaṁ sāmīcikammaṁ, karoti taṁ rājā pasenadi kosalo tathāgate🔽nipaccakāraṁ abhivādanaṁ paccuṭṭhānaṁ añjalikammaṁ sāmīcikammaṁ, na naṁ ‘sujāto samaṇo
analyzed: paccuṭṭhānam añjali kammam sāmīci kamma karoti tam rājā pasenadi kosalaḥ tathāgate  nipaccakāram abhivādanam paccuṭṭhānam añjali kammam sāmīci kamma na nam su jātaḥ samaṇaḥ
translated: and the King of Kosala does for the Tathagata what the Sakyans do for him.🔽The King of Kosala does not think: ‘The ascetic Gotama is of good birth on both sides, of pure descent to the seventh genera­tion of ancestors, unassailable and impeccable in respect of birth.

original: gotamo, dujjātohamasmi.
analyzed: gotamaḥ dujjātaḥ ham asmi
translated: I am of low birth, of obscure origins, of doubtful ancestry, with a mere word for my pedigree.🔽The ascetic Gotama is powerful and mighty,

original: Balavā samaṇo gotamo, dubbalohamasmi.
analyzed: balavā samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ dubbalaḥ ham asmi
translated: I am weak and feeble.🔽The ascetic Gotama is handsome, graceful, pleasing to look at, possessing supreme beauty of complexion,

original: Pāsādiko samaṇo gotamo, dubbaṇṇohamasmi.
analyzed: pāsādikaḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ dubbaṇṇaḥ ham asmi
translated: I am ugly, ill-formed, unsightly, of dark complexion.🔽The ascetic Gotama is the chief, the leader, the best, the most excellent, the supreme, the highest, the incomparable one, the possessor of knowledge and vision, the Accomplished One, the Fully Enlightened One,

original: Mahesakkho samaṇo gotamo, appesakkhohamasmī’ti.🔽Atha kho naṁ dhammaṁyeva sakkaronto dhammaṁ garuṁ karonto dhammaṁ mānento dhammaṁ
analyzed: mahesakkhaḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ appesakkhaḥ aham asmi iti  atha kho nam dhammayā iva sakkarontaḥ dhammam garum karontaḥ dhammam mānentaḥ dhamma
translated: and he is honoured, respected, revered, worshipped and venerated by me.’🔽But he does honour, respect, reverence, worship and veneration to the Tathagata because of the Dhamma.🔽And so, Vasettha, the King of Kosala does for the Tathagata what the Sakyans do for him,

original: pūjento dhammaṁ apacāyamāno evaṁ rājā pasenadi kosalo tathāgate nipaccakāraṁ karoti,🔽abhivādanaṁ paccuṭṭhānaṁ añjalikammaṁ sāmīcikammaṁ.
analyzed: pūjentaḥ dhammam apacāyamāno evam rājā pasenadi kosalaḥ tathāgate nipacca kāram karoti 🔽abhivādanam paccuṭṭhānam añjali kammam sāmīcikamma
translated: and the Sakyans do for the Tathagata what the King of Kosala does for him.

original: Imināpi kho etaṁ, vāseṭṭha, pariyāyena veditabbaṁ, yathā dhammova seṭṭho janetasmiṁ, diṭṭhe ceva dhamme abhisamparāyañca.
analyzed: iminā api kho eta vāseṭṭha pariyāyena veditabba yathā dhammaḥ uva seṭṭhaḥ janetasmi diṭṭhe ca iva dhamme abhisamparāyan ca
translated: This is another way of understanding how the Dhamma is the best thing in the world, both in this life and the next.

original: Tumhe khvattha, vāseṭṭha, nānājaccā nānānāmā nānāgottā nānākulā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajitā.
analyzed: tumhe khvattha vāseṭṭha nānā jaccāḥ nānā nāmāḥ nānā gottāḥ nānā kulāḥ agārasmai anagāriyam pabbajitā
translated: You, Vasettha, have gone forth from the house life into homelessness from various families, with various names, various clans, various castes.

original: ‘Ke tumhe’ti—puṭṭhā samānā ‘samaṇā sakyaputtiyāmhā’ti—paṭijānātha.🔽Yassa kho panassa, vāseṭṭha, tathāgate saddhā niviṭṭhā mūlajātā patiṭṭhitā daḷhā
analyzed: ke tumhe iti puṭṭhā samānā samaṇā sakyaputtiyā amha atipaṭijānātha  yassa kho panassa vāseṭṭha tathāgate saddhā niviṭṭhā mūla jātā patiṭṭhitā daḷhā
translated: And when asked, ‘What are you?’ you reply, ‘I am a Sakyan monastic.’

original: asaṁhāriyā samaṇena vā brāhmaṇena vā devena vā mārena vā brahmunā vā kenaci vā lokasmiṁ,
analyzed: samaṇena vā brāhmaṇena vā devena vā mārena vā brahmunā vā kenacid vā
translated: But if you have confirmed confidence in the Buddha, the Dhamma, and the Sangha, and have the virtues loved by noble ones,

original: tassetaṁ kallaṁ vacanāya:
analyzed: tassa itam kallam vacanāya
translated: then it is proper for you to say:

original: ‘bhagavatomhi putto oraso mukhato jāto dhammajo dhammanimmito dhammadāyādo’ti.
analyzed: bhagavataḥ mhi puttaḥ orasaḥ mukhataḥ jātaḥ dhamma jaḥ dhamma nimmitaḥ dhamma dāyādaḥ ti
translated: ‘I am the Tathagata’s son, born of his breast, born of his mouth, born of the Dhamma, created by the Dhamma, an heir in the Dhamma, not an heir in material things.’

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: Why is that?

original: Tathāgatassa hetaṁ, vāseṭṭha, adhivacanaṁ ‘dhammakāyo’ itipi, ‘brahmakāyo’ itipi, ‘dhammabhūto’ itipi, ‘brahmabhūto’ itipi.
analyzed: tathāgatassa heta vāseṭṭha adhivacanam dhamma kāyaḥ itipi brahma kāyaḥ itipi dhamma bhūtaḥ itipi brahma bhūtaḥ itipi
translated: Because, Vasettha, the Tathagata is called one whose body is the Dhamma, one whose body is Brahma, one who has become the Dhamma, one who has become Brahma.

original: Hoti kho so, vāseṭṭha, samayo yaṁ kadāci karahaci dīghassa addhuno accayena ayaṁ loko saṁvaṭṭati.
analyzed: hoti kho saḥ vāseṭṭha samayaḥ yam kadāci karahaci dīghassa addhunaḥ accayena ayam lokaḥ savaṭṭati
translated: “There comes a time, Vasettha, when after the lapse of a long period this world begins to expand again.

original: Saṁvaṭṭamāne loke yebhuyyena sattā ābhassarasaṁvattanikā honti.
analyzed: sa vaṭṭamāne loke yebhuyyena sattāḥ ābhassarasavattanikāḥ honti
translated: When the world is expanding in this way, beings for the most part pass away from the world of streaming radiance and are reborn here.

original: Te tattha honti manomayā pītibhakkhā sayaṁpabhā antalikkhacarā subhaṭṭhāyino ciraṁ dīghamaddhānaṁ tiṭṭhanti.
analyzed: te tattha honti manaḥ mayāḥ pīti bhakkhāḥ saya pabhāḥ antalikkha carāḥ subha ṭṭhāyinaḥ ciram dīgham addhānam tiṭṭhanti
translated: Here they are mind-made, feeding on rapture, self-luminous, moving through the air, abiding in glory.

original: Hoti kho so, vāseṭṭha, samayo yaṁ kadāci karahaci dīghassa addhuno accayena ayaṁ loko vivaṭṭati.
analyzed: hoti kho saḥ vāseṭṭha samayaḥ yam kadāci karahaci dīghassa addhunaḥ accayena ayam lokaḥ vivaṭṭati
translated: “There comes a time, Vasettha, when after the lapse of a long period this world begins to contract again.

original: Vivaṭṭamāne loke yebhuyyena sattā ābhassarakāyā cavitvā itthattaṁ āgacchanti.
analyzed: vivaṭṭamāne loke yebhuyyena sattāḥ ābhassara kāyā cavitvā itthattam āgacchanti
translated: When the world is contracting in this way, beings for the most part pass away from this world and are reborn in the world of streaming radiance.

original: Tedha honti manomayā pītibhakkhā sayaṁpabhā antalikkhacarā subhaṭṭhāyino ciraṁ dīghamaddhānaṁ tiṭṭhanti.
analyzed: te idha honti manaḥ mayāḥ pīti bhakkhāḥ saya pabhāḥ antalikkha carāḥ subha ṭṭhāyinaḥ ciram dīgham addhānam tiṭṭhanti
translated: Here they are mind-made, feeding on rapture, self-luminous, moving through the air, abiding in glory.

original: 2. Rasapathavipātubhāva
analyzed: rasa patha vipātu bhāva
translated: The appearance of the earth as food

original: Ekodakībhūtaṁ kho pana, vāseṭṭha, tena samayena hoti andhakāro andhakāratimisā.
analyzed: ekodakībhūtam kho pana vāseṭṭha tena samayena hoti andhakāraḥ andhakāra timisā
translated: At that time, Vasettha, the whole world was covered by one great ocean.

original: Na candimasūriyā paññāyanti, na nakkhattāni tārakarūpāni paññāyanti, na rattindivā
analyzed: na candima sūriyā paññāyanti na nakkhattāni tāraka rūpāni paññāyanti na
translated: The moon and the sun appeared, night and day became known, the stars and constellations appeared,

original: paññāyanti, na māsaḍḍhamāsā paññāyanti, na utusaṁvaccharā paññāyanti, na itthipumā
analyzed: paññāyanti na māsa ḍḍha māsā paññāyanti na utu savat charā paññāyanti na itthi pumā
translated: months and fortnights became known,

original: paññāyanti, sattā sattātveva saṅkhyaṁ gacchanti.
analyzed: paññāyanti sattā sattā tu eva saṅkhyam gacchanti
translated: and the years and seasons became known.

original: Atha kho tesaṁ, vāseṭṭha, sattānaṁ kadāci karahaci dīghassa addhuno accayena rasapathavī udakasmiṁ samatani;
analyzed: atha kho tesa vāseṭṭha sattānam kadāci karahaci dīghassa addhunaḥ accayena rasa pathavī udakasmiṃ samatani
translated: Then, Vasettha, after a very long period of time, the earth-essence arose in the water,

original: seyyathāpi nāma payaso tattassa nibbāyamānassa upari santānakaṁ hoti;
analyzed: seyyathā api nāma payasaḥ tattassa nibbāyamānassa upari santānakam hoti
translated: just as when ghee or oil has been poured on water, it remains on the surface without mixing with the water.

original: evameva pāturahosi.
analyzed: evam eva pātuḥ ahosi
translated: So it was with the earth-essence.🔽It was of good colour, smell and taste, like fine ghee or pure honey.

original: Sā ahosi vaṇṇasampannā gandhasampannā rasasampannā, seyyathāpi nāma sampannaṁ vā sappi sampannaṁ vā navanītaṁ evaṁvaṇṇā ahosi.🔽Seyyathāpi nāma khuddamadhuṁ aneḷakaṁ;
analyzed: sā ahosi vaṇṇa sampannā gandha sampannā rasa sampannā sā iyyathā api nāma sampannam vā sappi sampannam vā navanītam evavaṇṇā ahosi  seyyathā api nāma khudda madhum aneḍaka
translated: It was of good colour and smell,

original: evamassādā ahosi.
analyzed: ahosi
translated: and of good taste.

original: Atha kho, vāseṭṭha, aññataro satto lolajātiko:
analyzed: atha kho vāseṭṭha aññataraḥ sattaḥ lola jātikaḥ
translated: Then, Vasettha, a certain being, greedy by nature,

original: ‘ambho, kimevidaṁ bhavissatī’ti rasapathaviṁ aṅguliyā sāyi.
analyzed: ambho kim eva idam bhavissati iti rasa pathavim aṅguliyā sāyi
translated: ‘What might this be?’ and tasted it with his finger.

original: Tassa rasapathaviṁ aṅguliyā sāyato acchādesi, taṇhā cassa okkami.
analyzed: tassa rasa pathavim aṅguliyā sāyataḥ acchādesi taṇhā ca assa okkami
translated: As he tasted it, he liked it, and craving arose in him.

original: Aññepi kho, vāseṭṭha, sattā tassa sattassa diṭṭhānugatiṁ āpajjamānā rasapathaviṁ aṅguliyā sāyiṁsu.
analyzed: aññe api kho vāseṭṭha sattā tassa sattassa diṭṭha anugatim āpajjamānāḥ rasa pathavim aṅguliyā
translated: Other beings, following his example, tasted the earth-essence with their fingers.

original: Tesaṁ rasapathaviṁ aṅguliyā sāyataṁ acchādesi, taṇhā ca tesaṁ okkami.
analyzed: tesam rasa pathavim aṅguliyā sa āyatam acchādesi taṇhā ca tesam okkami
translated: As they tasted it, they liked it, and craving arose in them.

original: 3. Candimasūriyādipātubhāva
analyzed: candima sūriya ādi pātubhāva
translated: The appearance of the moon and sun

original: Atha kho te, vāseṭṭha, sattā rasapathaviṁ hatthehi āluppakārakaṁ upakkamiṁsu paribhuñjituṁ.
analyzed: atha kho te vāseṭṭha sattāḥ rasa pathavim hatthehi āluppa kārakam upakkamisu paribhuñjitu
translated: Then those beings, with their hands, took up the earth-essence in lumps and ate it.

original: Yato kho te, vāseṭṭha, sattā rasapathaviṁ hatthehi āluppakārakaṁ upakkamiṁsu paribhuñjituṁ.🔽Atha tesaṁ sattānaṁ sayaṁpabhā antaradhāyi.🔽Sayaṁpabhāya antarahitāya candimasūriyā pāturahesuṁ.
analyzed: yatas kho te vāseṭṭha sattāḥ rasa pathavim hatthehi āluppa kārakam upakkamisu paribhuñjitu  atha tesam sattānam saya pabhā antaradhāyi  anta rahitāya candima sūriyā pātu rahesu
translated: As they did so,🔽their self-luminosity disappeared.🔽With the disappearance of their self-luminosity, the moon and sun appeared.

original: Candimasūriyesu pātubhūtesu nakkhattāni tārakarūpāni pāturahesuṁ.
analyzed: candima sūriyesu pātubhūtesu nakkhattāni tāraka rūpāni pātu rahesu
translated: With the appearance of the moon and sun, the stars and constellations appeared.

original: Nakkhattesu tārakarūpesu pātubhūtesu rattindivā paññāyiṁsu.🔽Rattindivesu paññāyamānesu māsaḍḍhamāsā paññāyiṁsu.
analyzed: nakkhattesu tāraka rūpesu pātubhūtesu rattindivā paññāyisu  rattindivesu paññāyamānesu māsa ḍḍha māsā
translated: When the stars and constellations appeared in the sky, night and day were distinguished.🔽When night and day were distinguished, the months and fortnights were distinguished.

original: Māsaḍḍhamāsesu paññāyamānesu utusaṁvaccharā paññāyiṁsu.
analyzed: māsa ḍḍha māsesu paññāyamānesu utu savaccharā paññāyisu
translated: When the months and fortnights were distinguished, the years were distinguished.

original: Ettāvatā kho, vāseṭṭha, ayaṁ loko puna vivaṭṭo hoti.🔽Atha kho te, vāseṭṭha, sattā rasapathaviṁ paribhuñjantā tambhakkhā tadāhārā ciraṁ dīghamaddhānaṁ aṭṭhaṁsu.
analyzed: ettāvatā kho vāseṭṭha ayam loko puna vivaṭṭaḥ hoti  atha kho te vāseṭṭha sattāḥ rasa pathavim paribhuñjantā tambhakkhāḥ tad āhārāḥ ciram dīgham addhānam aṭṭhasu
translated: In this way, Vasettha, the world begins to expand.

original: Yathā yathā kho te, vāseṭṭha, sattā rasapathaviṁ paribhuñjantā tambhakkhā tadāhārā🔽ciraṁ dīghamaddhānaṁ aṭṭhaṁsu tathā tathā tesaṁ sattānaṁ rasapathaviṁ paribhuñjantānaṁ
analyzed: yathā yathā kho te vāseṭṭha sattāḥ rasa pathavim paribhuñjantā tambhakkhāḥ tad āhārāḥ  ciram dīgham addhānam aṭṭhasu tathā tathā tesam sattānam rasa pathavim
translated: Then, Vasettha, those beings, feeding on the essence of the earth, found that it filled them less and less, and they were afflicted by hunger and weakness.🔽As they fed on the essence of the earth, their bodies became coarser still, and the difference in their appearance became greater.

original: kharattañceva kāyasmiṁ okkami, vaṇṇavevaṇṇatā ca paññāyittha.🔽Ekidaṁ sattā vaṇṇavanto honti, ekidaṁ sattā dubbaṇṇā.
analyzed: kharattam ca iva kāyasmiṃ okkami vaṇṇa vevaṇṇa tā ca paññāyittha  eka idam sattāḥ vaṇṇavantaḥ honti eka idam sattāḥ dubbaṇṇā
translated: Some became beautiful, some ugly.

original: Tattha ye te sattā vaṇṇavanto, te dubbaṇṇe satte atimaññanti:
analyzed: tattha ye te sattāḥ vaṇṇavantaḥ te dubbaṇṇe satte atimaññanti
translated: And the beautiful ones despised the ugly ones, saying:

original: ‘mayametehi vaṇṇavantatarā, amhehete dubbaṇṇatarā’ti.🔽Tesaṁ vaṇṇātimānapaccayā mānātimānajātikānaṁ rasapathavī antaradhāyi.
analyzed: mayam etehi vaṇṇavantatarāḥ amhehi ete dubbaṇṇatarā ti  tesam vaṇṇa atimāna paccayā māna atimāna jātikānam rasa pathavī antaradhāyi
translated: ‘We are more beautiful than they are, they are uglier than we are.’🔽And because of their vanity and pride, the earth-essence disappeared.

original: Rasāya pathaviyā antarahitāya sannipatiṁsu.
analyzed: rasāya pathaviyāḥ antarahitāya sannipatisu
translated: When the earth-essence had disappeared, they gathered together.

original: Sannipatitvā anutthuniṁsu:
analyzed: sannipatitvā
translated: And they lamented:

original: ‘aho rasaṁ, aho rasan’ti.
analyzed: aho rasa aho rasanti
translated: ‘Oh, the earth-essence! Oh, the earth-essence!’

original: Tadetarahipi manussā kañcideva surasaṁ labhitvā evamāhaṁsu:
analyzed: manussā kañcid eva su rasam labhitvā evam āhasu
translated: Even today, when people get something very tasty, they say:

original: ‘aho rasaṁ, aho rasan’ti.
analyzed: aho rasa aho rasanti
translated: ‘Oh, how tasty! Oh, how tasty!’

original: Tadeva porāṇaṁ aggaññaṁ akkharaṁ anusaranti, na tvevassa atthaṁ ājānanti.
analyzed: tat eva porāṇam aggaññam akkharam anusaranti na tu eva assa attham ājānanti
translated: They are just repeating an ancient saying, without knowing its meaning.

original: 4. Bhūmipappaṭakapātubhāva
analyzed: bhūmi pappaṭaka pātubhāva
translated: The appearance of the earth-crust

original: Atha kho tesaṁ, vāseṭṭha, sattānaṁ rasāya pathaviyā antarahitāya bhūmipappaṭako pāturahosi.🔽Seyyathāpi nāma ahicchattako; evameva pāturahosi.

original: Tesaṁ no amhākaṁ kadāci karahaci dīghassa addhuno accayena rasapathavī udakasmiṁ samatani.
analyzed: tesam naḥ amhākam kadāci karahaci dīghassa addhunaḥ accayena rasa pathavī udakasmin
translated: And after a very long time, the earth’s essence appeared in the water.

original: Sā ahosi vaṇṇasampannā gandhasampannā rasasampannā.
analyzed: sā ahosi vaṇṇa sampannā gandha sampannā rasa sampannā
translated: It was beautiful, fragrant, and tasty.

original: Te mayaṁ rasapathaviṁ hatthehi āluppakārakaṁ upakkamimha paribhuñjituṁ, tesaṁ no rasapathaviṁ hatthehi āluppakārakaṁ upakkamataṁ paribhuñjituṁ sayaṁpabhā antaradhāyi.
analyzed: te mayam rasa pathavim hatthehi āluppa kārakam upakkamimha paribhuñjitu tesam no rasa pathavim hatthehi āluppa kārakam upakkamatam paribhuñjitum sayapabhā antaradhāyi
translated: We approached it with our hands, thinking it was food, and ate it. And as we ate it, our self-luminosity disappeared.

original: Sayaṁpabhāya antarahitāya candimasūriyā pāturahesuṁ, candimasūriyesu pātubhūtesu🔽nakkhattāni tārakarūpāni pāturahesuṁ, nakkhattesu tārakarūpesu pātubhūtesu rattindivā
analyzed: antarahitāya candima sūriyā pāturahesu candima sūriyesu pātubhūtesu  nakkhattāni tāraka rūpāni pāturahesu nakkhattesu tāraka rūpesu pātubhūtesu rattindivā
translated: When our self-luminosity disappeared, the sun and moon appeared.🔽When the sun and moon appeared, the stars and constellations appeared.

original: paññāyiṁsu, rattindivesu paññāyamānesu māsaḍḍhamāsā paññāyiṁsu.🔽Māsaḍḍhamāsesu paññāyamānesu utusaṁvaccharā paññāyiṁsu.
analyzed: paññāyisu rattindivesu paññāyamānesu māsa ḍḍha māsā  māsa ḍḍha māsesu paññāyamānesu utu savaccharā paññāyisu
translated: When the stars and constellations appeared, the day and night appeared.🔽When the day and night appeared, the months and half-months appeared.

original: Te mayaṁ rasapathaviṁ paribhuñjantā tambhakkhā tadāhārā ciraṁ dīghamaddhānaṁ aṭṭhamhā.
analyzed: te mayam rasa pathavim paribhuñjantā tambhakkhā tad āhārā ciram dīgham addhānam aṭṭhamhā
translated: When the months and half-months appeared, the seasons and years appeared.🔽We continued to eat the earth’s essence for a very long time.

original: Tesaṁ no pāpakānaṁyeva akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ pātubhāvā rasapathavī antaradhāyi.
analyzed: tesam no pāpakānayā iva akusalānam dhammānam pātubhāvā rasa pathavī antaradhāyi
translated: With the appearance of these bad, unwholesome qualities, the earth’s essence disappeared.

original: Rasapathaviyā antarahitāya bhūmipappaṭako pāturahosi.
analyzed: rasa pathaviyāḥ antara hitāya bhūmipappaṭakaḥ
translated: With the disappearance of the earth’s essence, the ground-creeper appeared.

original: So ahosi vaṇṇasampanno gandhasampanno rasasampanno.
analyzed: saḥ ahosi vaṇṇa sampannaḥ gandha sampannaḥ rasa sampannaḥ
translated: It was beautiful, fragrant, and tasty.

original: Te mayaṁ bhūmipappaṭakaṁ upakkamimha paribhuñjituṁ.🔽Te mayaṁ taṁ paribhuñjantā tambhakkhā tadāhārā ciraṁ dīghamaddhānaṁ aṭṭhamhā.
analyzed: te mayam bhūmipappaṭakam upakkamimha paribhuñjitu  te mayam tam paribhuñjantā tambhakkhā tad āhārā ciram dīgham addhānam aṭṭhamhā
translated: We approached the ground-creeper to consume it.🔽We consumed it for a long time.

original: Tesaṁ no pāpakānaṁyeva akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ pātubhāvā bhūmipappaṭako antaradhāyi.
analyzed: tesam no pāpakānayā iva akusalānam dhammānam pātubhāvā bhūmi pappaṭakaḥ antaradhāyi
translated: With the appearance of these bad, unwholesome qualities, the ground-creeper disappeared.

original: Bhūmipappaṭake antarahite padālatā pāturahosi.
analyzed: bhūmipappaṭake anta rahite
translated: With the disappearance of the ground-creeper, the stalk-creeper appeared.

original: Sā ahosi vaṇṇasampannā gandhasampannā rasasampannā.🔽Te mayaṁ padālataṁ upakkamimha paribhuñjituṁ.🔽Te mayaṁ taṁ paribhuñjantā tambhakkhā tadāhārā ciraṁ dīghamaddhānaṁ aṭṭhamhā.
analyzed: sā ahosi vaṇṇa sampannā gandha sampannā rasa sampannā  te mayam padālatam upakkamimha paribhuñjitu  te mayam tam paribhuñjantā tambhakkhā tad āhārā ciram dīgham addhānam aṭṭhamhā
translated: It was beautiful, fragrant, and tasty.🔽We approached the stalk-creeper to consume it.🔽We consumed it for a long time.

original: Tesaṁ no pāpakānaṁyeva akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ pātubhāvā padālatā antaradhāyi.
analyzed: tesam no pāpakānayā iva akusalānam dhammānam pātubhāvā padāla tā antaradhāyi
translated: With the appearance of these bad, unwholesome qualities, the stalk-creeper disappeared.

original: Padālatāya antarahitāya akaṭṭhapāko sāli pāturahosi akaṇo athuso suddho sugandho taṇḍulapphalo.🔽Yaṁ taṁ sāyaṁ sāyamāsāya āharāma, pāto taṁ hoti pakkaṁ paṭivirūḷhaṁ.
analyzed: a kaṭṭha pāko sāli a kaṇaḥ athuso suddhaḥ sugandho taṇḍula pphalo  yam tam sāyam sāyamāsāya āharāma tam hoti pakkam paṭivirūḍha
translated: And then, as the rice was being harvested, unhusked rice appeared, and it ripened again each day.🔽In the evening we would gather what we needed for the night,

original: Yaṁ taṁ pāto pātarāsāya āharāma, sāyaṁ taṁ hoti pakkaṁ paṭivirūḷhaṁ.
analyzed: yam tam pāto pāta rāsāya āharāma sāyam tam hoti pakkam paṭivirūḍha
translated: and in the morning we would gather what we needed for the day.

original: Nāpadānaṁ paññāyittha.
analyzed: na apadānam paññāyittha
translated: And no wastage was apparent.

original: Te mayaṁ akaṭṭhapākaṁ sāliṁ paribhuñjantā tambhakkhā tadāhārā ciraṁ dīghamaddhānaṁ aṭṭhamhā.🔽Tesaṁ no pāpakānaṁyeva akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ pātubhāvā kaṇopi taṇḍulaṁ pariyonandhi,
analyzed: te mayam a kaṭṭha pākam sālim paribhuñjantā tambhakkhā tad āhārā ciram dīgham addhānam aṭṭhamhā  tesam no akusalānam dhammānam pātubhāvā kaṇaḥ api taṇḍulam pariyonandhi
translated: And so we lived on for a very long time, subsisting on that unhusked rice and eating it raw.🔽But as a result of our evil and unwholesome states of mind, the rice became overgrown with weeds.

original: thusopi taṇḍulaṁ pariyonandhi, lūnampi nappaṭivirūḷhaṁ, apadānaṁ paññāyittha, saṇḍasaṇḍā sālayo ṭhitā.
analyzed: thusaḥ upi taṇḍulam lūnam pi na paṭivirūḍha apadānam paññāyittha saṇḍa saṇḍā sa ālayaḥ ṭhitā
translated: And when we tried to remove the weeds, the rice plants withered.

original: Yannūna mayaṁ sāliṁ vibhajeyyāma, mariyādaṁ ṭhapeyyāmā’ti.
analyzed: yat nūna mayam sālim vibhajeyyāma mariyādam ṭhapeyyāma ati
translated: We thought: ‘Let us now divide up the rice and set boundaries.’

original: Atha kho te, vāseṭṭha, sattā sāliṁ vibhajiṁsu, mariyādaṁ ṭhapesuṁ.
analyzed: atha kho te vāseṭṭha sattā sālim vibhajisu mariyādam ṭhapesu
translated: And so we divided up the rice and set boundaries.

original: Atha kho, vāseṭṭha, aññataro satto lolajātiko sakaṁ bhāgaṁ parirakkhanto aññataraṁ bhāgaṁ adinnaṁ ādiyitvā paribhuñji.
analyzed: atha kho vāseṭṭha aññataraḥ sattaḥ lola jātikaḥ sakam bhāgam parirakkhantaḥ aññataram bhāgam a dinnam ādiyitvā paribhuñji
translated: Then, Vasettha, one being, greedy by nature, having guarded his own portion, ate another’s portion without it being given.

original: Tamenaṁ aggahesuṁ, gahetvā etadavocuṁ:
analyzed: tam enam aggahesu gahetvā etat avocuḥ
translated: They caught him and said:

original: ‘pāpakaṁ vata, bho satta, karosi, yatra hi nāma sakaṁ bhāgaṁ parirakkhanto aññataraṁ bhāgaṁ adinnaṁ ādiyitvā paribhuñjasi.
analyzed: pāpakam vata bho satta karosi yatra hi nāma sakam bhāgam parirakkhantaḥ aññataram bhāgam a dinnam ādiyitvā paribhuñjasi
translated: ‘You are a wicked being, friend, in that having guarded your own portion you ate another’s portion without it being given.

original: Māssu, bho satta, punapi evarūpamakāsī’ti.
analyzed: māssu bho satta punar api evarūpam akāsi iti
translated: Don’t do such a thing again, friend.’

original: ‘Evaṁ, bho’ti kho, vāseṭṭha, so satto tesaṁ sattānaṁ paccassosi.
analyzed: eva bhoti kho vāseṭṭha saḥ satto tesam sattānam paccassosi
translated: ‘Yes, friends,’ that being consented to those beings.

original: Dutiyampi kho, vāseṭṭha, so satto …pe…
analyzed: dutiyam pi kho vāseṭṭha saḥ satto pe
translated: For a second time, Vasettha, that being …

original: tatiyampi kho, vāseṭṭha, so satto sakaṁ bhāgaṁ parirakkhanto aññataraṁ bhāgaṁ adinnaṁ ādiyitvā paribhuñji.
analyzed: tatiyam pi kho vāseṭṭha saḥ satto sakam bhāgam parirakkhantaḥ aññataram bhāgam a dinnam ādiyitvā paribhuñji
translated: For a third time, Vasettha, that being, having guarded his own portion, ate another’s portion without it being given.

original: Tamenaṁ aggahesuṁ, gahetvā etadavocuṁ:
analyzed: tam enam aggahesu gahetvā etat avocuḥ
translated: They caught him and said:

original: ‘pāpakaṁ vata, bho satta, karosi, yatra hi nāma sakaṁ bhāgaṁ parirakkhanto aññataraṁ bhāgaṁ adinnaṁ ādiyitvā paribhuñjasi.
analyzed: pāpakam vata bho satta karosi yatra hi nāma sakam bhāgam parirakkhantaḥ aññataram bhāgam a dinnam ādiyitvā paribhuñjasi
translated: ‘You are a wicked being, friend, in that having guarded your own portion you ate another’s portion without it being given.

original: Māssu, bho satta, punapi evarūpamakāsī’ti.
analyzed: māssu bho satta punar api evarūpam akāsi iti
translated: ‘Don’t do it again!’

original: Aññe pāṇinā pahariṁsu, aññe leḍḍunā pahariṁsu, aññe daṇḍena pahariṁsu.
analyzed: aññe pāṇinā paharisu aññe leḍḍunā paharisu aññe daṇḍena paharisu
translated: Some hit him with their fists, some with stones, and some with sticks.

original: Tadagge kho, vāseṭṭha, adinnādānaṁ paññāyati, garahā paññāyati, musāvādo paññāyati, daṇḍādānaṁ paññāyati.
analyzed: tad agge kho vāseṭṭha adinnādānam paññāyati garahā paññāyati musāvādaḥ paññāyati daṇḍa ādānam paññāyati
translated: At that time, Vasettha, theft, censure, lying and violence were seen in the world.

original: 10. Mahāsammatarājā
analyzed: mahāsammata rājā
translated: . The Great Elect

original: Atha kho te, vāseṭṭha, sattā sannipatiṁsu, sannipatitvā anutthuniṁsu:
analyzed: atha kho te vāseṭṭha sattā sannipatisu sannipatitvā
translated: Then, Vasettha, those beings came together and lamented the fact:

original: ‘pāpakā vata bho dhammā sattesu pātubhūtā, yatra hi nāma adinnādānaṁ paññāyissati, garahā paññāyissati, musāvādo paññāyissati, daṇḍādānaṁ paññāyissati.
analyzed: pāpakāḥ vata bho dhammāḥ sattesu pātubhūtāḥ yatra hi nāma adinnādānam paññāyissati garahā paññāyissati musāvādaḥ paññāyissati daṇḍa ādānam paññāyissati
translated: ‘Evil things have appeared among beings, in that theft, censure, lying and violence are seen.

original: Yannūna mayaṁ ekaṁ sattaṁ sammanneyyāma, yo no sammā khīyitabbaṁ khīyeyya, sammā garahitabbaṁ garaheyya, sammā pabbājetabbaṁ pabbājeyya.
analyzed: yat nūna mayam ekam sattam sammanneyyāma yaḥ no sammā khīyitabbam khīyeyya sammā garahitabbam garaheyya sammā pabbājetabbam pabbājeyya
translated: Let us elect a certain being who will be angry on our behalf when we have reason to be angry, will condemn when we have reason to condemn, and will banish when we have reason to banish.

original: Mayaṁ panassa sālīnaṁ bhāgaṁ anuppadassāmā’ti.
analyzed: mayam panassa sālīnam bhāgam anuppadassāma ati
translated: We, on our part, will give him a share of the rice.’

original: Atha kho te, vāseṭṭha, sattā yo nesaṁ satto abhirūpataro ca dassanīyataro ca pāsādikataro ca mahesakkhataro ca taṁ sattaṁ upasaṅkamitvā etadavocuṁ:
analyzed: atha kho te vāseṭṭha sattāḥ yaḥ nesam sattaḥ abhirūpataraḥ ca dassanīyataraḥ ca pāsādikataraḥ ca mahesakkhataraḥ ca tam sattam upasaṅkamitvā etat avocu
translated: Then, Vasettha, those beings approached the one among them who was the handsomest, best to look at, most pleasing and most capable, and said to him:

original: ‘ehi, bho satta, sammā khīyitabbaṁ khīya, sammā garahitabbaṁ garaha, sammā pabbājetabbaṁ pabbājehi.
analyzed: ehi bho satta sammā khīyitabbam khīya sammā garahitabbam garaha sammā pabbājetabbam pabbājehi
translated: ‘Come, good sir, reprove those who should be reproved, rebuke those who should be rebuked, banish those who should be banished.

original: Mayaṁ pana te sālīnaṁ bhāgaṁ anuppadassāmā’ti.
analyzed: mayam pana te sālīnam bhāgam anuppadassāma ati
translated: We will give you a share of the rice.’

original: ‘Evaṁ, bho’ti kho, vāseṭṭha, so satto tesaṁ sattānaṁ paṭissuṇitvā sammā khīyitabbaṁ khīyi, sammā garahitabbaṁ garahi, sammā pabbājetabbaṁ pabbājesi.
analyzed: eva bhoti kho vāseṭṭha saḥ satto tesam sattānam paṭissuṇitvā sammā khīyitabbam khīyi sammā garahitabbam garahi sammā pabbājetabbam pabbājesi
translated: ‘Very well,’ he replied, and he did so.

original: Te panassa sālīnaṁ bhāgaṁ anuppadaṁsu.
analyzed: te panassa sālīnam bhāgam
translated: And they gave him a share of the rice.

original: Mahājanasammatoti kho, vāseṭṭha, ‘mahāsammato, mahāsammato’ tveva paṭhamaṁ akkharaṁ upanibbattaṁ.
analyzed: mahā jana sammataḥ iti kho vāseṭṭha mahā sammataḥ mahā sammataḥ tu eva paṭhamam akkharam upanibbatta
translated: ‘He was agreed upon by the multitude’ - thus was the first syllable, ‘Mahā’ , produced.

original: Khettānaṁ adhipatīti kho, vāseṭṭha, ‘khattiyo, khattiyo’ tveva dutiyaṁ akkharaṁ upanibbattaṁ.
analyzed: khettānam adhipati iti kho vāseṭṭha khattiyaḥ khattiyaḥ tu eva dutiyam akkharam upanibbatta
translated: ‘Lord of the fields’ - thus was the second syllable, ‘Sammata’ , produced.

original: Dhammena pare rañjetīti kho, vāseṭṭha, ‘rājā, rājā’ tveva tatiyaṁ akkharaṁ upanibbattaṁ.
analyzed: dhammena pare rañjeti iti kho vāseṭṭha rājā rājā tu eva tatiyam akkharam upanibbatta
translated: He delighted others with Dhamma, so the third term ‘king’ came into use.

original: Iti kho, vāseṭṭha, evametassa khattiyamaṇḍalassa porāṇena aggaññena akkharena abhinibbatti
analyzed: iti kho vāseṭṭha evam etassa khattiya maṇḍalassa porāṇena aggaññena akkharena abhinibbatti
translated: So it was that this circle of nobles came into existence through an ancient title going back to the beginning,

original: ahosi tesaṁyeva sattānaṁ, anaññesaṁ. Sadisānaṁyeva, no asadisānaṁ. Dhammeneva, no adhammena.
analyzed: ahosi tesayā iva sattāna anaññesa sadisānayā iva no asadisāna dhammena iva no adhammena
translated: among those very same beings, not among others; among those of the same kind, not among those of a different kind; through what is right, not through what is wrong.

original: Dhammo hi, vāseṭṭha, seṭṭho janetasmiṁ diṭṭhe ceva dhamme abhisamparāyañca.
analyzed: dhammaḥ hi vāseṭṭha seṭṭhaḥ janetasmin diṭṭhe ca iva dhamme abhisamparāyan ca
translated: For Dhamma is the best thing for people in this life and the next.

original: 11. Brāhmaṇamaṇḍala
analyzed: brāhmaṇa maṇḍala
translated: The Circle of Brahmins

original: Atha kho tesaṁ, vāseṭṭha, sattānaṁyeva ekaccānaṁ etadahosi:
analyzed: atha kho tesa vāseṭṭha etat ahosi
translated: Then, Vasettha, some of those beings thought:

original: ‘pāpakā vata, bho, dhammā sattesu pātubhūtā, yatra hi nāma adinnādānaṁ paññāyissati, garahā paññāyissati, musāvādo paññāyissati, daṇḍādānaṁ paññāyissati, pabbājanaṁ paññāyissati.
analyzed: pāpakāḥ vata bho dhammāḥ sattesu pātubhūtāḥ yatra hi nāma adinnādānam paññāyissati garahā paññāyissati musāvādaḥ paññāyissati daṇḍa ādānam paññāyissati pabbājanam paññāyissati
translated: ‘Evil things have appeared among beings, in that we find theft, lying, and the taking up of sticks.

original: Yannūna mayaṁ pāpake akusale dhamme vāheyyāmā’ti.
analyzed: yat nūna mayam pāpake akusale dhamme vāheyyāma ati
translated: Let us now practise good conduct by abstaining from these things.’

original: Te pāpake akusale dhamme vāhesuṁ.
analyzed: te pāpake akusale dhamme vāhesu
translated: And they did so.

original: Pāpake akusale dhamme vāhentīti kho, vāseṭṭha, ‘brāhmaṇā, brāhmaṇā’ tveva paṭhamaṁ akkharaṁ upanibbattaṁ.
analyzed: pāpake akusale dhamme vāhenti iti kho vāseṭṭha brāhmaṇāḥ brāhmaṇā tu eva paṭhamam akkharam upanibbatta
translated: ‘They drive out evil, unwholesome states’—thus, Vasettha, it was for this that the Brahmins of old first took up the name ‘Brahmins’.

original: Te araññāyatane paṇṇakuṭiyo karitvā paṇṇakuṭīsu jhāyanti vītaṅgārā vītadhūmā pannamusalā sāyaṁ sāyamāsāya pāto pātarāsāya gāmanigamarājadhāniyo osaranti ghāsamesamānā.
analyzed: te arañña āyatane paṇṇa kuṭiyaḥ karitvā paṇṇa kuṭīsu jhāyanti vīta aṅgārā vīta dhūmā panna musalā sāyam sāyamāsāya pāto pāta rāsāya gāma nigama rājadhāniyaḥ osaranti ghāsam esamānā
translated: ‘They built leaf-huts in the forest and meditated there, without fire, without cooking, gathering raw food, sesame seed and rice, and descending to the villages only once a year to ask for grain.

original: Te ghāsaṁ paṭilabhitvā punadeva araññāyatane paṇṇakuṭīsu jhāyanti.
analyzed: te ghāsam paṭilabhitvā punadeva arañña āyatane paṇṇa kuṭīsu jhāyanti
translated: And when they had obtained food, they returned to their leaf-huts in the forest to meditate.

original: Tamenaṁ manussā disvā evamāhaṁsu:🔽‘ime kho, bho, sattā araññāyatane paṇṇakuṭiyo karitvā paṇṇakuṭīsu jhāyanti, vītaṅgārā
analyzed: tam enam manussāḥ disvā evam āhasu  ime kho bho sattā arañña āyatane paṇṇa kuṭiyaḥ karitvā paṇṇa kuṭīsu jhāyanti vīta aṅgārā
translated: And when people saw them, they said:🔽“These beings build leaf-huts in the forest and meditate there, without fire, without cooking, gathering raw food, sesame seed and rice.

original: vītadhūmā pannamusalā sāyaṁ sāyamāsāya pāto pātarāsāya gāmanigamarājadhāniyo osaranti ghāsamesamānā.
analyzed: vīta dhūmā panna musalā sāyam sāyamāsāya pāto pāta rāsāya gāma nigama rājadhāniyaḥ osaranti ghāsamesamānā
translated: And they descend to the villages only once a year to ask for grain.

original: Te ghāsaṁ paṭilabhitvā punadeva araññāyatane paṇṇakuṭīsu jhāyantī’ti,
analyzed: te ghāsam paṭilabhitvā punadeva arañña āyatane paṇṇa kuṭīsu jhāyanti iti
translated: And when they have obtained food, they return to their leaf-huts in the forest to meditate.”

original: jhāyantīti kho, vāseṭṭha, ‘jhāyakā, jhāyakā’ tveva dutiyaṁ akkharaṁ upanibbattaṁ.
